Aqua Park Group does not operate a phone line service, all bookings help is handled speedily by our aqua park heroes via email. If you have a booking related question, Get in touch via: Aqua Park Lakeside, Alexandra Lake, Lakeside Shopping Centre RM20 2AB lakeside@aquaparkgroup.co.uk Aqua Park Rutland, Bull Brig Lane, Oakham, Rutland, LE15 8BL rutland@aquaparkgroup.co.uk Cosmeston Lakes Aqua Park, Lavernock road, Penarth, CF64 5UY cardiff@aquaparkgroup.co.uk Planning your trip? What to know before you go: I have booked but now seen a discount code or offer, can I use it? No, discount codes cannot be applied to bookings retrospectively or outside the valid booking and redemption dates specified online and in advertisements. Orders placed using discount codes cannot be used in conjunction with any other offer. Stop the spread of invasive species. Check – Clean – Dry your equipment and clothing. Help stop the spread of invasive plants and animals. Personal wetsuit and wetshoe use is is not permitted at Cosmeston lakes, You can help protect the environment and activities you enjoy by keeping your kit free of invasive plants and animals, whenever you leave the water remember to: Check your clothing after leaving the water for mud, aquatic animals or plant material. Remove anything you find and leave it at the site. Clean everything thoroughly as soon as you can, paying attention to areas that are damp or hard to access. Use hot water if possible. Dry everything for as long as you can before using elsewhere. What should I do with my kit and equipment? Fo safety reasons, Aqua Park must supply a correctly fitted buoyancy aid, you cannot bring your own. Personal wetsuit use is not permitted at Cosmeston Lakes. Personal wetsuit use is permitted at Lakeside and Rutland. Remember to Check – Clean – Dry to stop the Spread of aquatic invasive species.  This poster highlights good practice for water users : When is Cosmeston Lakes Aqua Park Open? We are open at Cosmeston Lakes from Saturday 5th July 2025 7 days a week until 7th September. The weekend only for 13th & 14th September. Click book a splash to see times and availability. What about the wildlife at Cosmeston Lakes? A detailed ecological assessment, undertaken by local firm Acer Ecology, has confirmed that the seasonal Aqua Park at Cosmeston Lakes Country Park will have no significant negative impact on local birdlife or water vole populations. The Aqua Park will be situated away from sensitive bird nesting areas, further reducing any potential for disruption. The eastern lake, already supports a range of recreational activities such as paddleboarding, sailing, dog walking and scuba diving. The study shows that bird species in the area are already well adapted to this level of human activity. Many common bird species show high tolerance to disturbance and are unlikely to be affected by the seasonal operation of the inflatable water park, which are temporary structures. Extensive surveys and habitat assessments on water voles where carried out, which found that the area proposed for the Aqua Park has limited suitability for water voles. The park will be located on open shoreline lacking the vegetation that water voles rely on, and no signs of burrows or active vole presence were found in that specific zone. As such, the risk of harming water vole populations is considered negligible. The parks SSSI status is there because of one species of rare underwater plant, starry stonewart, which is only found in the western lake, the eastern lake is formally designated as suitable for recreational activity. The seasonal nature of the attraction, combined with safeguards, that the Aqua Park can operate safely and responsibly whilst maintaining the park’s wildlife conservation goals. What’s the water quality like at Cosmeston Lakes? Your safety is our top priority. The Aqua Park only opens when water quality meets recognised safety standards and conditions are safe for activities to take place. During the spring of 2025, a professional scuba diving team has surveyed the lakebed where the Aqua Park is located, in conjunction with a bathymetric depth survey, to confirm that there are no objects under the surface and that the water depth is suitable (3m – 12m). Our water samples are tested and analysed by Public Heath Wales at their UKAS-accredited laboratory. We take two samples at the same time and from the same location on the Aqua Park, which are tested side by side. This helps us identify any potential sampling or laboratory errors, as the two results should be very close to each other. For transparency, the graphs shown on our website display the average of the two results. Our closure policy is precautionary and always based on the worst result . We have been taking samples twice a week during the 2025 bathing season to ensure water quality remains safe. Two key indicators are tested: E. coli Intestinal Enterococci These bacteria occur naturally in the gut of humans and animals. Most strains are harmless, but high levels can indicate pollution and may pose a risk if swallowed. We follow guidance given directly to us by Swim England , who have stated that there should be no swimming when results are above the levels below. These are the same fail levels as World Aquatics and The Aqua Park Association, following national and international governing bodies 1,000 CFU/100ml for E. coli 400 CFU/100ml for Intestinal Enterococci Aqua Park Sessions may only resume once subsequent testing has shown results are below these thresholds .We also adopt many of the principles of the World Aquatics testing regime , alongside the requirements of our own industry body, the Aqua Park Association , which accredits Aqua Parks across the UK. These same standard levels are applied across the country to a wide range of open water recreational activities, from Aqua Parks to open water swimming and even designated inland bathing waters. The graphs show bacteria levels over time, measured in colony-forming units (CFU) per 100ml . The red line shows the Fail threshold. Beneath the red is considered Good Quality The green line shows the Excellent threshold. All our results from the 2025 bathing season are published here. To date, the water has consistently met the standards required for safe bathing. Where is Cosmeston Lakes Aqua Park? Cosmeston Lakes Country Park, Lavernock road, Penarth, CF64 5UY You need to arrive at the Aqua Park at least 30 minutes before your session start time , so please plan your journey. My Season Pass isn’t working? Your unique membership number can be found on your email with subject line *Your Name*, your season pass details are here. It is a 18 digital code e.g: 130258742-435081393 Your season pass code only works on the matching ticket type . At step 3 of the checkout, you’ll need to click the ‘use membership’ box and enter the full membership code without a hashtag there. Please watch this tutorial video to ensure you are adding the correct ticket type to the basket, and entering the code correctly: https://www.youtube.com/watch? v=fgHK8KZwDv8 Ensure that when you select your preferred session date you select either: 1hr Seasonaire session ticket option if you are a standard season pass holder. 2hr Super Seasonaire session ticket option if you are a super season pass holder. If you have any further problems using your code, please ensure you haven’t exceeded the 2 booking per week usage limit, and email us and let us know and we’ll endeavour to help further. Can I cancel or move my season pass ticket booking? You can reschedule your Season Pass ticket booking online at no extra cost, provided your Season Pass session is more than 1 day away. Head here to create an online account to manage your bookings: 1. Login 2. Go to my tickets tab using the ticket icon 3. View upcoming bookings 4. Click view details: Click edit booking 5. Select a new date and time; do not add additional tickets to the basket. 6. Scroll down to Re-schedule 1 item: click checkout 7. Update the booking without further payment If you are unable to attend and can’t cancel your booking online, please contact our customer service team on customerservices@ aquaparkgroup.co.uk , and they will process your cancellation. We endeavour to assist all of our visitors, a ‘best effort’ policy applies to rescheduling requests under 7 days’ notice and there are no guarantees. Failure to attend more than 3 bookings without cancellation will result in your season pass being cancelled without refund. What’s your lost property policy? We make a best effort approach to ensure any valuables you leave behind are returned to their rightful owners. Valuables, such as lost mobile phones that are found or handed in, must be unlocked either using the passcode or biometric login in front of a manager in order to be released. Ou lost property is to be stored in the manager’s office. Bank cards are to be destroyed upon being found and disposed of upon being handed in by a manager with a witness to prevent financial fraud. Other valuable items should be described in detail in advance of seeing the item, e.g a ring, or a photo provided showing proof of ownership. Personal items e.g. boxers/pants/swimshorts/flip-flops, and perishable items will not be stored, with a value of £20 or under will not be stored – they are either to be disposed of or donated. Is the water safe for swimming in? Yes – The Aqua Park is only open to customers when the water quality meets EU Bathing Standards and is safe for activities to take place. Aqua Park Rutland follows a regular regime of Water Quality Testing provided by Anglian Water. Aqua Park Lakeside follows a regular regime of Water Quality Testing provided by Swim Safety . Aqua Park Cardiff follows a regular regime of water quality testing by a UKAS-accredited lab in South Wales. Preventing Illness & Infections from swimming in open water: What can be done to reduce the risks? The risk of contracting a serious illness is low, but by taking sensible precautions, the risk of infection can be further reduced. You should: – Cover any cuts with a waterproof dressing; – Wear footwear to protect feet from cuts; – Avoid ingesting (drinking) the water; – Wash your hands, especially before eating and drinking, with liquid soap and fresh water. You can do this immediately after the activity, at one of the hand-wash stations provided. Wash or shower when you get home. What should I do if I feel unwell after visiting the Aqua Park? In all open freshwater in the UK, there is a very low risk of catching infections, diseases and or infections. If you feel unwell after visiting Aqua Park, then please email us to let us know, especially if you are experiencing vomiting and diarrhoea, as soon as you can. Please advise us when you visited the Aqua Park, what symptoms you are experiencing and when you started to experience them. Can I view my bookings and tickets online? Seasonaires/Season Pass holders with a disability can make an application for a free Carer Pass that goes alongside the current Pass held. Once your application has been approved, you can make the booking online for the disabled guest, and email us to add the carer pass to the booking, you can not book a carer season pass online. The Carer Pass is issued to the disabled guest and will have the name, date of birth and a photo of the disabled guest. It is therefore transferrable between carers and will not be bound to any specific carer. Please buy a Season Pass for the disabled guest and send proof of entitlement to us via email. The proof of entitlement accepted is the same as for a carer’s ticket (see previous section). Please note that a Carer Pass cannot be used without the presence of the disabled Passholder that it goes alongside. This is because the Pass is designed to offer assistance to the disabled guest only. A carer must be over 14 years of age and capable of assisting the guest who has the disability. The carer would be expected to understand the disabled person’s condition and assist them in managing it for the duration of their visit. If more than one carer’s ticket is required, a letter from a GP or consultant is needed stating the number of carers required. The support must be due to disability-related needs. For proof of disability, please provide any ONE of the following forms of documentation: Entitlement to Disability Living Allowance for children under 16 or DLA/Personal Independent Payments (PIP) for those aged 16-64, either in the form of a letter stating that the benefit has been awarded, or the actual Allowance book Attendance Allowance or Carer’s Allowance letter of award Incapacity Benefit books, or a letter notifying the recipient that the benefit has been awarded Incapacity Benefit or Employment and Support Allowance (ESA) A valid Blue Badge In the case of visual impairment, a registration card known as the BD8 or a Certificate of Visual Impairment (CVI) A local authority registration document which is local to the attraction where it is being submitted Credibility’s Access Card Do I need a Lifeguard qualification to apply as a Trainee Lifeguard? No, we train our Trainee Lifeguards in the RLSS 3-day Open Water Lifeguard Qualification .  After which we also train Trainees in the RLSS Aqua Park Module. What can I expect at a Duty Manager, or Manager interview? We conduct first-stage interviews online, if you are successful we will then invite you to meet face-to-face. We are looking for natural leaders who can create the right working environment for our teams, so that they can in turn deliver the best experiences for our visitors at our parks, in a safe environment! Please think about examples of how you can demonstrate a proactive approach with good judgement and forward planning in a commercial role. Have you got examples of managing a team to meet targets and to deliver results? We are also interested in people managing a sales team, or experience selling leisure activities and memberships! Does my Lifeguard qualification need to be valid for the whole summer season? If you already hold a recognised Lifeguarding qualification then ideally it should be valid for the whole of the summer in which you are applying to work. Through the interview process we will check your qualification and its expiry date. You must commit to undertaking ongoing training and training updates as required. What Lifeguarding qualifications do you recognise? We work in partnership with the RLSS, The Royal Life Saving Society UK, who award recognised lifeguarding qualifications in the UK. Our training programme offers Open Water Lifeguard Qualifications. You may apply if you already hold an NPLQ National Pool Lifeguard Qualification or NBVLQ National Beach Lifeguard Qualification, but you will need to undergo open water training with us. We are unable to recognise qualifications obtained overseas, such as the ARC American Red Cross Lifeguard certification. All successful applicants will undergo training onsite and undergo the RLSS Aqua Park Module. Is there a minimum age in order to apply? If you are age 16 or over then you can apply to work with us. Can I wear spectacles on the Aqua Park? For safety reasons, spectacles are not permitted on the Aqua Park. As it involves physical activity where slips, trips, bumps, and falls are likely, this policy helps prevent personal injury, loss or damage. Prescription goggles or contacts are a good alternative. Can I wear Fancy Dress? Unfortunately, you cannot wear any loose clothing on the Aqua Park, therefore we do not allow any fancy dress. However, we are still all about having fun! So you are welcome to wear brightly coloured swim hats, swimsuits, or budgie smugglers on top of your wetsuits which is a great way to stand out on a Stag or Hen! Can I participate if I am pregnant? If there is any possibility you might be pregnant, you should not take part. What if it’s raining, windy or thunder storms forecast? Rain : You can still take part in the rain- you are going to get wet anyway ! The Aqua Park is great fun in the rain! Wind: Wind speed and direction at our venues is continuously monitored through a dedicated weather station installed on-site. Real-time data will be accessible to staff responsible for enforcing this policy. When the weather station records wind speeds consistent with or exceeding Beaufort Force 6 for a sustained period, the park will be closed. Thunder and Lightening: Safety First: The safety of all visitors is of utmost importance. When thunder and lightning are observed over the water, all activities will be temporarily stopped to ensure the safety of participants and staff. 20-Minute Wait: Activities will only resume after a visual confirmation that the storm has passed. Once the last lightning strike over the water has occurred, a mandatory waiting period of 20 minutes will be enforced before activities can resume. This waiting period is essential to ensure the safety of all involved. Constant Monitoring: Throughout the waiting period and the resumption of activities, weather conditions will be continuously monitored. If thunder and lightning resume during this period, the 20-minute wait period will reset, and activities will remain on hold until another 20 minutes have passed without any lightning strikes. Individual Consideration: The impact on ticket holders will be assessed on an individual basis in respect of refund and credits. Notification : Aqua Park Group reserve the right to cancel or reschedule Your Session at any time when reasonably required with no prior notice due to severe weather. We will inform You as soon as reasonably possible if We need to cancel or reschedule Your Session. However, we cannot guarantee that you will be informed of such cancellation if you have not provided the correct contact details for your booking. In the first instances this will be via text and or email. You will receive a gift certificate for the value of Your Order which You can use to re-book for an available Session. The cancellation or rescheduling of Your Session does not automatically entitle You to a refund. What Happens if my session is cancelled? Each month our organisation receives dozens of approaches and donation applications. In view of the growing number of requests we receive, we have now created a short guide to our donations policy – the scope of which is to provide background on the cause(s) we support and how we will consider all future requests. Overall Policy Aqua Parks Group seeks to contribute to the communities in which we live and work in a number of ways. In addition to providing employment opportunities and minimising our environmental impact, we aim to provide individuals and families with the opportunity to get fit and enjoy outdoors Watersports activities. We would like to be able to donate to all of the worthy registered charities that contact us, but the high demand inevitably means we have to limit our donations. We have decided that In order to achieve the best effect we will focus on a single charity of choice over a two-year cycle and we will review our policy each year to monitor impact and effect. 2023-2025 period – please note that we have selected a charity as a focus of all of our donations and this charity is Above Water, as a result, no further donations of any kind will be considered. For more information on what Above Water Responsibility for the coordination of sponsorship lies with the Directors of The Aqua Parks Group. The donations fund is therefore focussed on registered charitable organisations that: Work across the community close to operational sites and/or have connections to the industry in which we operate. What we fund We will only consider applications from charities and non-profit organisations that demonstrate how a donation will enhance the well-being or safety of people through improved /health/welfare or environment. Your organisation must be a registered charity and working in: Health Education and wellbeing Environment-based or working in or around our area of operation. What we will not fund Individuals who are looking for sponsorship for fundraising activities of any type of political organisation and campaigns or any initiative that is outside of the criteria outlined above. How to apply If your organisation and proposed funding initiative fit our criteria please submit your donation request by email to cs@aquaparkgroup.co.uk We are unable to respond to applications sent via post. Timescales We review applications once every two years. The next meeting will be in December 2023. To submit a donation request on behalf of your chosen event or cause, please tell us a little about your cause and your intended use of any donation we make. Season pass holders are allocated a select number of tickets at every session start time we have available (every 20 minutes) You are able to book Seasonaire 1hr or 2hr seasonaire sessions only, general admission tickets sold separately. Additional advance bookings can be made at the general admission price. If you wish to visit again for free on the same day please check availability with reception upon arrival. (free double ups*) On your first visit, we will take profile photos and assign them to your account . Each season pass is personal and only the person in the photo ID on the account will be able to use it. The sharing of season passes with others will result in the termination of your pass without a refund. We encourage all visitors to respect this rule for the benefit of all our guests. Season passes are non transferable – photo ID checks will be made at reception before tickets are issued. If you have booked on behalf of someone else then your season pass(es) will be cancelled without refund and you will be subject to the charge of the general admission price at the ticket office. If you are unable to attend please contact us or cancel your booking via your online account Failure to attend more than 3 bookings without cancelation will result in your season pass being cancelled without refund. If we are unable to fulfil your booking for any unforeseen reason you will be able to rebook into another session. No refunds or credits will be considered . The week runs 00:01 Sunday – 23:59 Saturday. Season passes are personal and non-transferable, just like a gym membership! Season passes must be purchased for your ‘home’ location; The Aqua Park location you will visit the most. Season passes cannot be used alongside group and school bookings in conjunction with group discounts and offers. When are the season passes valid? The passes are valid for the whole summer season across all our locations during the calendar year they are purchased in. Our season runs from May through September and opening times may vary, please see the bookings page for opening times. Usage Limits : You are able to book or attend a maximum of 2 FREE bookings per week , per season pass holder. The week runs 00:01 Sunday – 23:59 Saturday. Season passes are personal and non-transferable, just like a gym membership! How do I redeem my season pass? Once you’ve purchased your pass(es), you’ll be sent your personal season pass code that you can use to redeem on Seasonaire sessions. Season pass holders are allocated a select number of tickets at every session start time we have available (every 20 minutes). Season passes are not redeemable on general admission tickets. You can buy multiple passes from one account so managing a family pass is easy. On your first visit to the Aqua Park, our team will set up profile photos for the seasonaires at reception. Each pass is personal and non-transferable, much like a gym membership. Wetsuit hire is not included in the season pass. What does being a standard or SUPER season pass holder give you? A season pass gives you admission to the 3 of the UK’s Ultimate Aqua Park locations for a whole season full of thrills and spills! As a standard season pass holder ( seasonaire as we like to call them) you can book Seasonaire 1hr sessions on any day we are open, at any 3 locations for FREE! As a SUPER season pass holder (super seasonaire ) you can book Seasonaire 2hr sessions on any day we are open, at any 3 locations for FREE! Usage Limits : You are able to book or attend a maximum of 2 FREE bookings per week , per season pass holder. The week runs 00:01 Sunday – 23:59 Saturday. Season passes are personal and non-transferable, just like a gym membership! Season pass holders are allocated a select number of tickets at every session start time we have available (every 20 minutes) Wetsuit hire is included free for Cosmeston Lakes Season pass holders , as wearing personal wetsuits is not permitted. When are Peak / Off Peak ticket times? Peak = Saturdays, Sundays, Bank holidays. Off Peak = Monday – Friday. Who needs to complete a Waiver? Everyone attending the Aqua Park must complete a waiver prior to arrival for your session! Waivers must be completed by all attendees, or their parent/guardian if they are under 18 , before arriving on site. Any waivers completed at Ticket Office will be charged a £5 administration charge. The link to this is found in your order confirmation/website menu. Wetsuits: Do I have to wear a wetsuit? Do I have to wear a wetsuit? Wearing a wetsuit is highly recommended, they provide UV protection from the sun and a low risk of friction burns. Alternatively, you can wear suitable swimwear or gym shorts/leggings to protect you on slides and cover your shoulders with a t-shirt or rash vest. We may ask that they are required when the water temp or weather is cooler. Cost? When you book, and pay for your ticket, wetsuit hire is NOT included. There is no price reduction. You can purchase one online before your visit. Wetsuit hire can be pre-booked online – if you choose not to wear it on the day no refund is given. Wetsuit hire costs more on the day. You are welcome to bring your own wetsuit if you are attending Rutland Water and Thurrock Lakeside only. Personal wetsuits and wetsuit boots/ wetshoes use is not permitted at Cosmeston Lakes. If using an Aqua Park wetsuit, you must wear swimwear underneath for hygiene reasons. Sizes? We have Adult and Youth size wetsuits from age 6 to XXXXL adults. Only wetsuit boots or barefoot are permitted on the park. If you choose to go barefoot on the park, we recommend wearing shoes / flip flops on the shore before and after your session that you do not mind getting wet. Where can I store my belongings? Lockers are available at the park. They require a small combination padlock to lock them, you are welcome to bring your own. Alternatively, they can be purchased at Reception. We advise that you secure all your belongings and valuables, we accept no responsibility for any items left unattended. What do I wear or bring with me? Arrive in your swimwear 30 minutes before your session start time. We recommend preparing for a day out at the beach! Recommended packing list: A beach Towel or a changing robe. A change of clothes. A small padlock for our lockers (like gym/leisure centre lockers) flip flops/sliders/Crocs or old trainers you don’t mind getting wet to walk around the site in to protect your feet. A water bottle to stay hydrated. Suncream. Hand sanitiser. Picnic blankets and or camping chairs if you’re spectating. Note, personal wetsuit use is not permitted at Cosmeston Lakes. What time should I get there? Arrive at least 30 minutes before your session starts, this will allow you to check-in and change. We ask that just your group leader checks the group in. You only need your confirmation email – please help us reduce our waste as there is no need to print anything. Please note it is your responsibility to arrive on time, please get travel information and plan your visit with any local events or bank holidays in mind . If in doubt, allow extra time! If for any reason, you miss your session. We will not refund you but will try our best to accommodate you on another session. However, we cannot guarantee there is availability. What are the ages, parental supervision, swimming ability and admissions criteria? Swimming Ability It is a requirement than you can swim 25m unaided and you should be confident in the water as are likely to go underwater. You have to be able to pull yourself up out of the water, and it can be tiring. Height Restriction There is a minimum height of 1.20m permitted on the Aqua Park. There is no weight restriction. Age: Rutland and Lakeside: Open to children aged 6 + Age: Cosmeston Lakes: Open to children aged 8 + Parental Supervision Rutland and Lakeside: Open to children aged 6 and 7 years old can attend any session provided that an adult or guardian of 18+ is supervising them on the Aqua Park at all times, on a 1 adult to 3 children ratio . Children aged 8 to 15 years old inclusive must have either an over 18 adult/guardian supervising and observing from the shore , or on the Aqua Park with them for the duration of the session. 16 years old and over can attend any session without supervision. Parental Supervision Cosmeston Lakes : Children aged 8 to 15 years old inclusive must have either an over 18 adult/guardian supervising and observing from the shore , or on the Aqua Park with them for the duration of the session. 16 years old and over can attend any session without supervision. How do I Book? All bookings can be made online in advance via the website, click book a splash and follow the instructions. (note tickets go on sale in April, only gift cards are available online until then) If there appears to be nothing available on the day you want to book, it is because all sessions are taken/the park is closed on this date. Please remember before booking that all ticket sales are final . All bookings must be made online in advance to avoid disappointment. Once you have booked, you must ensure that you and/or your party have completed their waiver online before arriving . Simply follow the instructions sent in the confirmation email. If you do not complete the waiver online and have to complete one at the Ticket Office, there will be a £5 administration charge. We wanted to create a place for families to share our core values of enjoying time spent on the water, sharing laughs, and making memories together. Fast forward to now and this original vision is still anchored at the heart of everything we do. Over the years thousands of friends, families, teams, and colleagues have visited our Aqua Parks. About Us – Water Works Engineers Skip to navigation Skip to content INSTAGRAM FACEBOOK LINKEDIN Water Works Engineers Toggle navigation menu Home Who We Are About Us Our Approach Leadership Team What We Do Alternative Project Delivery Construction Administration Conveyance Systems Drinking Water Engineering Design Infrastructure Rehabilitation Master Planning Reclaimed Water / Advanced Water Treatment Utility Management Wastewater Treatment Our Work Careers Contact Us info@wwengineers.com About Us Who We Are Water covers about 70% of the Earth’s surface, but less than 1% is accessible for human use. Despite its scarcity, we depend on water for nearly every need, from agricultural to industrial to domestic. With water scarcity becoming an increasingly critical issue, particularly in the Southwest, where rainfall is minimal, Water Works Engineers is dedicated to addressing this pressing challenge with innovative engineering solutions. Founded in 2005, Water Works Engineers offers professional engineering services to the municipal water and wastewater sector, from initial concept development through to facility operation. As specialists in water, we possess an unmatched understanding of and sensitivity to Western water and wastewater issues. We operate offices across Arizona, California, Idaho, New Mexico, and Utah and extend our services to neighboring states in the Southwest. Water Works Engineers was established to redefine the engineering firm experience. We are committed to delivering exceptional client service through highly experienced engineers in a hands-on, interactive, and enjoyable environment. Where We Work To serve our clients across the Western United States, Water Works Engineers operates offices and employs staff in Scottsdale, Arizona; Los Angeles, Redding, Roseville, San Diego, and San Mateo, California; Albuquerque, New Mexico; Star, Idaho; and Salt Lake City, Utah. In addition to our office locations, we hold licenses in numerous states and have provided engineering services for projects in Hawaii, Nevada, Oregon, Texas, and Washington. Community Involvement We are committed to serving our communities by delivering essential services such as reliable sewer systems and safe drinking water. Our commitment extends beyond our core services. At Water Works Engineers, being active members of our communities is a top priority. We sponsor sports teams, support local parks, advocate for STEM education, and engage in outreach events as a team. Below, you can find highlights of our recent events and sponsorships. STEM EDUCATION STEM Education We have participated in a 9th Grade STEM Career Day for all Shasta County, CA to encourage our next generation to pursue science, technology, engineering, and mathematic-related careers. WATER FOR PEOPLE 5K WATER FOR PEOPLE 5K The Water Works’ Scottsdale, AZ office annually participates in the Water For People Annual 5K Run for World Water to raise money for this great cause. PINTS FOR PEOPLE SPONSOR PINTS FOR PEOPLE SPONSOR Water Works has sponsored Pints for People which raises money for Water for People, whose purpose is to bring water and sanitation to every family, every school, and every clinic in which it works. CA YOUTH SPORTS TEAMS SPONSORSHIPS CA YOUTH SPORTS TEAMS SPONSORSHIPS We have been sponsoring many youth sports teams in Northern California to support our local communities. AZ YOUTH SPORTS TEAMS SPONSORSHIPS AZ YOUTH SPORTS TEAMS SPONSORSHIPS Water Works is a proud supporter of the Shadow Mountain Little League in Phoenix, Arizona. KINDER COLLEGE DAY KINDER COLLEGE DAY Water Works was happy to participate in the College Options, Inc. event Kinder College Day, 2023. Introducing hundreds of Shasta County kindergarten students to the idea of college and career possibilities and encouraging the next generation of engineers. SPCA DOGGY DASH SPONSOR SPCA DOGGY DASH SPONSOR Water Works is a proud supporter of the Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (SPCA) Doggy Dash! SWE Stem Day Camp SWE STEM Day Camp WaterWorks annually sponsors the Wow! That’s Engineering day camp for 4th-6th grade girls in California. Happy Hollow Park & Zoo Happy Hollow Park & Zoo We  support the Happy Hollow Park & Zoo to aid in exhibit enhancements, animal care, life science lessons for disadvantaged schools, and more. About Erie Water Works | Who We Are 24 Hour Emergency: 814.870.8087 Call 811 Before You Dig Pay by Phone: 1.833.759.5406 Contact Us Search keyword or phrase search Home Customer Service Manage Your Account Payment Options Rates & Fees About Your Bill Customer Service Forms FAQs Using Water Wisely Open Records Bulk Water Fill Station Contacts Who We Are What We Do Engineering Services General & Contact Information Project Planning Backflow Prevention Geographic Information System Standard Construction Details Standard Water Service Details Lead Line Grant Project Careers Contact Report an Issue Pay Your Bill 24 Hour Emergency: 814.870.8087 Call 811 Before You Dig Pay by Phone: 1.833.759.5406 Erie Water Works Who We Are Mission Statement / About Us Erie Water Works Board Senior Management Service Areas History Locations Vendor Information Our Mission Statement: “To guarantee a continuous, uninterrupted, reasonably priced supply of quality water to its customers which assures public health while promoting regional stability and future development.” The Erie Water Works assumed operations of Erie’s water system on January 1, 1992. The Erie Water Works is an independent organization whose goal is to operate, maintain and rehabilitate the water system for the Erie, Pennsylvania region, while providing service at an affordable cost. Working together to make a difference, Water Works employees stand by the community they work for and their Mission Statement. Please enjoy a seven minute video which briefly outlines the history of Erie’s water system and describes the Erie Water Works commitment to providing this precious and abundant resource to our community. Sr. Manager, Engineering Services 814.870.8000  ext. 202 Email Service Areas The Erie Water Works serves the City of Erie, Lawrence Park Township, Wesleyville Borough, Harborcreek Township, Millcreek Township, McKean Township, McKean Borough, and portions of Summit and Greene Townships. Additionally, bulk water is sold directly to the Summit Township Water Authority and Fairview Township Water Authority for distribution to their customers. The map below depicts the primary and bulk service supply areas of Erie Water Works. Download Map PDF Potable water is essential to economic growth and development. The City of Erie and many of its surrounding municipalities are fortunate to be located within the boundaries of the Great Lakes Drainage Basin (GLDB). Water within the basin replenishes Lake Erie’s water supply. In turn, the water from Lake Erie can be used as public water to areas located within the GLDB. The water from Lake Erie is protected from being diverted outside the GLDB by the Water Resources Development Act of 1986 insuring an abundant supply of water for future generations. The Great Lakes Water Basin is depicted as the blue-shaded areas in the map below and exists as the potential expansion service area of Lake Erie water. Download Map PDF Erie Water Works History 1815-1840 Water came from shallow wells and natural springs, like the Brown’s Hotel’s two natural springs. 1910 “Big Bertha,” a 20 million gallon per day MGD Bethlehem Triple Expansion High Duty Pumping Engine was installed. 1930s A second pumping and filtration facility was completed servicing Southeastern Erie and Wesleyville. 1950s During an upgrade “Big Bertha” was replaced by three 18MGD Low Service Electric Motor Driven Pumps. 1994-1996 Completed construction of the South Booster Station and the Sigsbee Care Takers House was restored. 2000-2002 Chestnut Street Pumping Station was renovated 2005 Construction of the 12th and Myrtle Distribution Storage Facility was completed. 2006-2007 Several Water Main Replacement and/or Extension projects were completed. Concerts & Ticketing - Water Works Park Foundation Events In the Park Cultural Series Local Bands, Brews and Bikes An Adventure In the Park Harvest & Handmade Fair Tinseltown In the Park Plan Your Visit Event Calendar Des Moines Biergarten Oktoberfest at Des Moines Biergarten Lauridsen Amphitheater Killinger Family Stage Concerts & Ticketing Parking About the Foundation Iowa Innovation Award Hurd Visionaries Support Volunteer News Subscribe Contact Us Select Page Concerts & Ticketing Concerts & Ticketing Do children need tickets? All concert attendees will need a ticket, regardless of age, to be able to enter the venue. Will tickets be available to purchase locally? There is no box office before show day. At door time, the box office will be open for tickets if not sold out and is located to the right of the main gate. www.firstfleetconcerts.com . Will tickets be available day of show? If the show does not sell out, then tickets will be available at www.firstfleetconcerts.com and will be available to purchase with cash or credit at the door. What does VIP include? VIP packages are different for every show; check the ticketing link for the specific show to find out what each VIP package includes. www.firstfleetconcerts.com Can minors be in the VIP area? Yes! There is no age restriction for the VIP section at the Lauridsen Amphitheater, but everyone will need a VIP ticket to enter. www.firstfleetconcerts.com Do VIP purchasers have access to other areas in the venue? VIP purchasers will have access to all areas of the show area inside the venue. They can bring chairs, but only set up in the GA lawn area. Chairs are not allowed in the VIP section. Are pets allowed into the concert area? No. We love our pets, too, but please don’t bring them to the concert. However, service animals are welcome. Can I upgrade to the VIP tickets if I have purchased general admission tickets already? Yes, you will need to contact boxoffice@woolysdm.com to upgrade your GA tickets to VIP/reserved seating tickets if they are available. Where are my tickets? The easiest way to get your tickets is to find your email order confirmation or log into your ticket app account on your phone. If you have any outstanding issues, please get in touch with boxoffice@woolysdm.com or visit the ticket booth next to the main gate upon entry. Can I get a refund? Tickets for all shows are non-refundable. Is parking available? For your convenience, designated drop-off areas for Uber, Lyft, and Taxi services are available in the DMWW Administration Building Parking Lot at 2201 George Flagg Parkway. Handicap parking is also conveniently located in the parking lot closest to the venue. Parking is activated based on conditions and event size, so be sure to check the parking maps associated with each event. For larger events, the Unity Point Health Bike Valet is at your service on the west side of the venue. Look for directional signs as you approach the park, making it easy for you to utilize this convenient service. Car parking fees vary based on the parking lot’s accessibility. For certain events, off-site shuttle service is offered as well. To purchase parking in advance, click here . Where is ADA parking located? ADA accessible parking drop-off and parking are available for all events. Paved and gradually sloped paths lead to all designated seating areas. A designated ADA accessible entry into the venue and seating area, along with a dedicated space for a companion chair (bring your lawn chair), will be made available at each show, ensuring that your companion is also accommodated. What am I allowed to bring in the venue? If you have purchased reserved seating and have a ticket with a row and seat listed, you do not need to bring anything into the venue for seating. With a general admission/lawn ticket, you have the freedom to bring in a lawn chair and blanket, giving you control over your comfort during the event. For your convenience, an empty water bottle is allowed at entry. You can easily refill it at the free water stations in the venue, courtesy of Des Moines Water Works Park. Remember, our bag policy allows for a clear bag or a smaller bag that is 8.5 x 11″ or smaller. All bags may be subject to search upon entering the venue. What is the bag policy? Remember, our bag policy allows for a clear bag or a smaller bag that is 8.5 x 11″ or smaller. All bags may be subject to search upon entering the venue. What items can I not bring into the venue? No weapons of any kind. No umbrellas or wagons. You cannot bring food or beverages into the ticketed area for concerts. Food and drinks will be available for sale inside the venue when the gates open. Venue Info Where is the Lauridsen Amphitheater located? (Map) The Lauridsen Amphitheater at Water Works Park is located at 2201 George Flagg Pkwy, Des Moines, IA 50321. View Directions What form of payment do you accept for parking? Going to one of the shows this summer? Download the imClutch app to prepay and reserve your parking space in advance. It’s all on your phone. No more waiting for change or realizing you’re out of cash. We’ll scan your QR Code and get you to the lot so you can enjoy the Park before the show. https://reserve.imclutch.com/waterworkspark Where do I park my bike or car? (Map) Generally, for events, Parking Areas A, B, and/or C will be activated for car parking based on conditions and the event size. Check the parking maps associated with each event. There will also be designated drop-offs for Uber, Lyft, and taxis in the DMWW Administration Building Parking Lot, located at 2201 George Flagg Parkway. Handicapped parking is available in the parking lot closest to the venue. The Unity Point Bike Valet will also be available for larger events. Please be sure to look out for directional signs as you approach the park. Going to one of the shows this summer? Download the imClutch app to prepay and reserve your parking space in advance. It’s all on your phone. No more waiting for change or realizing you’re out of cash. We’ll scan your QR Code and get you to the lot so you can enjoy the Park before the show. https://reserve.imclutch.com/waterworkspark Is the Amphitheater wheelchair accessible? (Map) Yes. ADA drop-off and Handicap Parking will be available for all events. Paved and gradually sloped paths lead to all designated seating areas. A designated wheelchair seating area and space for a companion chair (bring your lawn chair) will be available at each show. What can I bring into the venue? Lawn chairs, blankets, refillable water bottles. What items are not allowed? No weapons of any kind. No umbrellas or wagons. You cannot bring food or beverages into the ticketed area for concerts. However, you can bring them to free community events such as the Des Moines Symphony and Belin Quartet performances. Food and beverages will be available for sale. What if it rains? In case of severe weather, an alternate location will be announced. Are children free? No, all concert attendees will need a ticket. Is my ticket in a standing room only section? VIP is standing room only. Camping chairs are permitted in the “Lawn” area of the aarena Are food and drinks available for purchase? Yes. The department works to strengthen the city's workforce by addressing labor market gaps, expanding access to education, job training, and removing barriers to employment with a focus on underrepresented populations including young adults, and returning citizens. Meeting the individualized needs of job seekers requires collaboration with local businesses, educational institutions, nonprofits, public agencies, and technology. WPSP seeks to align Tampa's talent pipeline with in-demand careers, helping residents connect to meaningful, long-term economic opportunity. People Notify me when page changes Was this page helpful? We have volunteer opportunities throughout the City year around. Those interested in volunteering for us should review our Volunteer Handbook first. Once you are ready to volunteer, fill out the Volunteer Application and send it to: Tampa Parks and Recreation Department Volunteer Coordinator 3402 W. Columbus Drive Tampa, Florida 33607 If you have any questions regarding the volunteer process for our department, please feel free to send us an email . Additionally, we have outside non-profit organization partners that provide volunteer opportunities. These include: Children's Athletic Network and Dance Opportunities (CAN-DO) Friends of Tampa Recreation (FOTR) Keep Tampa Bay Beautiful (KTBB) To volunteer for any of the non-profits listed above, please contact them.
